alert.note: Alert for Juana Diaz; Villalba (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 6:53PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous heavy rains and excessive runoff continues. * WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following counties, Juana Diaz and Villalba. * WHEN...Until 800 PM AST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 PM AST, River gauge reports indicated excessive runoff from heavy rain due to thunderstorms continued. Minor flooding is ongoing and expected to continue in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continue minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
